newsitem.title: FRANCE: LVMH falls after on DFS concession loss.
newsitem.headline: LVMH falls after on DFS concession loss.

text.p: Shares in LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton fell sharply on Tuesday, underperforming a weak market, after its Duty Free Shoppers subsidiary failed to win the contract for two concessions at the new Chep Lap Kok airport in Hong Kong, brokers said.
The stock was down 3.29 percent at 1,439 francs at 1030 GMT, while the CAC-40 index was 1.3 percent lower.
One broker said the concessions were among the largest in the world. Brokers said LVMH's shares were also undermined by the dollar's volatility.
